item.title: Learning to Learn: MPI
item.description: MPI is the de-facto standard way to write distributed programs that run on super computers. Many have tried to replace it, but so far none of them have succeeded. Learning to use it successfully, will enable you to write powerful distributed programs. Order of Topics MPI has a minimal powerful and useful core, but really tries to completely own it’s space. I strongly reccommend reading “Using MPI” by Gropp et al.
